Topic.Title: Your NVDA how-to's for today - enjoy!

Message.Msg: Honestly, I am not big believer in any of these micro technical formulas. Whether we see Wayne at CES or MWC I think is essentially a wash and for the most part not relevant. The momentum would essentially still be in play and I highly doubt that NVIDIA would forgo an opportunity to pump Wayne's debut at CES even if doesn't make a difference until it's a month later - not sure why they would postpone it a month anyway unless it had to do with customer announcements (makes little sense other wise). I also don't believe CES is a Qualcomm event either, in fact I think NVIDIA will raise a lot of eyebrows and overshadow Qualcomm's S4. Normally I would be there (still may) but I am stuck back east until at least this weekend. I still may make it though.

Topic.Title: Your NVDA how-to's for today - enjoy!

Message.Msg: PJ is headline speaker - catch his show on PBS from last night. Its a preview on the big arc announcements that QCOM will be making. there is no momentum behind NVDA, its still trading below its price from last qtr earnings. Its either the slowest moving setup to trap shorts or, just reality that investors are bearish on NVDA. Any other time, NVDA would be trading in the 14s.

Topic.Title: Your NVDA how-to's for today - enjoy!

Message.Msg: Again I don't believe in setups. The market is what it is and reading too much into it is futile. I am sure that the 14 price target has differed from year to year and depending on your sentiment the current price would look bearish or bullish. I do now the short term trend remains bullish as do the fundamentals, that is what I am sticking with. However, I have to believe, that even if investors are bearish, NVIDIA's continued stability and growing revenues will eventually change their sentiment. I will check out PJ but just because QCOMM but I wouldn't use that to discount NVIDIA's presence.

Message.Title: Intel to the rescue
Message.Msg: Davenport Cuts Surface Estimate; Can ‘Surface Pro’ Redeem It? blogsDOTbarronsDOTcom/techtraderdaily/2013/01/03/msft-davenport-cuts-surface-estimate-can-surface-pro-redeem-it/?mod=yahoobarrons Davenport & Co.’s Drake Johnstone today cuts his estimates for Microsoft (MSFT) to reflect much lower sales last quarter of the Surface tablet computer than he’d thought, arguing the device is hampered by its high price. However, Johnstone reiterates a Buy rating on the stock and a $35 price target, arguing that a new model expected this month, using Intel‘s (INTC) microprocessor in place of Nvidia‘s (NVDA) chip, could improve the appeal of the device for corporate users.

Message.Title: My 5 year resolution.
Message.Msg: Within the next 5 years NVDA market cap will exceed market cap of both INTC and QCOM. 1) Tegra business will be big and will dominate laptop, tablet and phone markets. AAPL will be smaller and will use Nvidia mobile products (at least modem). 2) Tesla+Tegra will own HPC business 3) Nvidia will own cloud GPU server market which will grow very fast 4) Nvidia will find a way to monetize cloud gaming business and will make it significant part of its portfolio. 5) Baseband modem business alone will grow really fast and will outpace Qualcomm's modem business 6) Nvidia will open new markets we don't even think about today.

Topic.Title: Venturebeat - "Nvidia has mostly lost the mobile chipset battle to Qualcomm"

Message.Msg: brokeagain - if you research Nvidia Tegra releases, you will see the timing Tegra 2 - announced Jan 5th 2011 in advance of CES 2011 nvidianewsDOTnvidiaDOTcom/Releases/NVIDIA-Tegra-Super-Chip-Kicks-Up-Next-Wave-of-Super-Phones-5eb.aspx Tegra 3 - announced Nov 8th 2011 in advance of CES 2012 nvidianewsDOTnvidiaDOTcom/Releases/NVIDIA-Quad-Core-Tegra-3-Chip-Sets-New-Standards-of-Mobile-Computing-Performance-Energy-Efficiency-59a.aspx these things tend to have a rhythm. At this point, you have to be a hopeless optimist to think Tegra 4 would debut at CES 2013 without any PR publicity. As it is, the media is so focused on Qualcomm and Samsung, can't imagine a tepid Tegra 4 announcement. As I said, tomorrow morning is the last chance for Nvidia to throw a monkey wrench in the works (for my setup) by announcing LTE 500 and Tegra 4.
